alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 4:10AM EDT until July 28 at 5:15AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Johnson and Martin. * WHEN...Until 715 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 409 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Inez, Warfield, Preece, Prince, Debord, Delong, Bradbury, Pevier, Davella, McClure, Davisport, Andy, Pleasant, Tomahawk, Lovely, Moree, Coalpoint, Stidham, Beauty and Wells.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
